unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Police Citations | 1 of 2
question_text:
Suppose a local police department decides to track how many minor citations its officers give per month.
The mean and standard deviation of the number of citations per month are $84.3$ and $12.6$, respectively. Suppose each citation has an average fine of $\$115.32$.
What are the mean and standard deviation of the revenue the police department takes in per month from minor citations?
solution:
In this situation, the mean and standard deviation should both be transformed by multiplying each term by $\$115.32$.

When multiplying data by any constant, both the mean and standard deviation is multiplied by this constant.

$\text{Mean} = 84.3 \times \$115.32 = \$9{,}721.48$

$\text{Standard deviation} = 12.6 \times \$115.32 = \$1{,}453.03$

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'C'.
